reviewText: THE APOCALYPSE is about a salvage team led by Sandra Bernhard (!!) attempting to acquire the cargo from a derelict spaceship. Unfortunately, Bernhard's team is comprised mostly of criminals of the psychopathic variety. Shockingly, they betray her, kill people,  and take over the mission. Little do they know that before their arrival, one of the ship's original crewmembers  (Laura San Giacomo) survived long enough to reprogram the computer. Now, they find out that they're aboard what amounts to a nuclear bomb headed for Earth! Can Bernhard and her ex-bartender fight off the bad guys and save the world? While the budget is extremely low, and the "acting" talent ranges from mediocre to driftwood-level, I still found enough to like in this little sci-fi epic. The story is interesting, and most of the annoying characters wind up dead! Worth a glimpse...
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was just awful.  There's some spaceship that's carrying some explosive cargo or something.  The ship's computer (played by Laura San Giacomo) goes insane and starts reciting Shakespeare.  This sends the ship on a collision course with Earth.  Since apparently nobody could care less if Earth is destroyed or not, they send Sandra Bernhard and a bunch of her loser friends to stop it.  There's also some bad guys who want to take control of the ship.  They're almost as stupid as Bernhard and her gang.  The "computer hacker" bad guy plays a game of complete-the-quote with the computer, thinking it will unlock the security system.  This is analogous to leaving the solitaire program loaded on your computer, and having a "computer hacker" think that if wins a game of solitaire, he will gain access to your system.  Real high-brow stuff here.  Bernhard, well, what can one say.  She's got a personality like a toilet in a downtown bus station, and she's not nearly as attractive as any of her male cohorts (this coming from a heterosexual male).  About the only - and I mean ONLY - redeeming quality of this movie is that one of the bad guys is a fairly hot babe who gets stripped down to her black bra before she's killed, but even she isn't nearly enough to make this thing watchable.If you've ever seen a low-budget sci-fi movie before, you know the whole plot to this thing, so I won't bother getting into it.Overall, just skip this thing.
summary: Sandra Bernhard makes my skin crawl

reviewText: After a few meteors hit the earth a group of people decide to renew faith, meet with loved ones, or question faith as the end of the world doesn't seem to fit too well in God's plan. What this film does is combine the bad script, bad acting and bad soundtrack of a classic Asylum rip-off production with the confused dialouge and theology of Faith Film. CG flames.The movie is primarily a bad drama with a science fiction background.I would recommend one avoid the film.
